website_summaries.verdict: At $200, the Asus RT-AC86U is one of the best all-around routers. It has all the latest features, including extra security for all of your devices. This router should maximize your bandwidth and keep your home network running smoothly.
pros: You can customize just about every setting and the 5GHz speeds are amazing
It also has gaming-centric features, security for your entire home and USB 3.1 Gen 1 for fast network storage and printing
cons: You can only use the app while you're connected to your home network, and the physical router has to stand upright with no wall mount option
It's only dual-band, so it lacks an extra 5GHz band to alleviate network congestion

customer_reviews.title: 6 months of use and 2.4 goes out, bad CS, joke warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it new 6 months ago, figured for the money it'd last a couple years. 6 months in and the 2.4ghz channel goes bad. Firmware, channels, legacy, n, 3x wifi adapters, different computers, factory resets and none of it fixed it. Customer service was useless. Slowly offered me nothing past what I'd already tried and then on a 6 month old unit they expect me to ship it to them and they'll "look" at it and the return window to me is a month lol. What a joke, borderline legal scamming. No person in their right mind will go a month without a router especially with slim chance of getting a real fix.
customer_reviews.author: GRKT

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy, typical ASUS
customer_reviews.text: Set up in less than 30 mins. Speed is as advertised and can outpace my 250 mb/s service. Changed only a few settings on setup although i reviewed all of them. Really like that it automatically switched to the lowest traffic channel and did not require a phone call to my isp. 3 months later, I still couldnt be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: I got what I paid for and more
customer_reviews.text: Paying for 400mbps and not getting it sucks. I upgraded my WiFi modem to this ASUS after the cable tech guy said my 5 year old WiFi modem was the bottleneck for speed. Well, it screams now, before I had 50-60mbps at best hitting my computers n phones. I test out at 866 Mbps 15-20 ft away in my living room now and 351 to 483 Mbps in my office 3 walls and 60 feet away. Solid connections no drop off, no lag for gaming and streaming movies there is no wait for buffering. Very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ray and Renate

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, GREAT Wifi range.
customer_reviews.text: Several years ago I purchased an ASUS router for my home Wifi. My house has grown as has my Wifi devices so I needed an upgrade. Again, I researched who was the best and found this ASUS router among the top. It's all it's claimed to be. Setup is pretty easy and the range is wonderful. I as struggling with several nagging network problems before I installed this, and now my home network (with ~50 devices) is stable. I've recommended this device to two other friends and helped one of them installed it. It solved their Wifi range problem nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi & Rick

customer_reviews.title: Works really well!!
customer_reviews.text: I am using two of these in a mesh configuration at home. It was reasonably easy to setup. I am using ethernet for backhaul. The wifi signal is now excellent all throughout the house. I have had to reboot the routers a couple of times in the couple of months -- but that's not so bad. Definitely recommended! PS: After 3 months, there seems to be a steady pattern that the routers need to be rebooted periodically -- every 7-15 days. Its a bit of an aggravation to see the network out every couple of weeks, but still happy with it overall.
customer_reviews.author: Musicfan

customer_reviews.title: Merlin is the way to go
customer_reviews.text: Our router handles quite a bit of traffic, two PS4’s, streaming, two high bandwidth WFH stations, security system with eight more end points, nest, i7 Roomba and a home grown server. We experience zero latency and always have a ping under 35ms. We currently run a “Merlin Firmware”; we’ve also hosted a PS4 party a few weeks ago where six tv’s and six PS4’s all connected with ZERO lag. Internet bandwidth is 100MBps. So even with a lower tier internet we’ve experienced next to no issues. Takes some minor setting up and there are some tech items as well; but you can easily google those from your phone if you run into any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline Carnell

customer_reviews.title: extended my range like 5x over from an RN56U
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTELY worth the money, extended my range like 5x over from an RN56U. I currently have 350mbps service, from 300ft away (same elevation no obstacles) I pull 296mbps ON WIFI! that's just INCREDIBLE. my biggest complaint is that my phone wants to connect from a block away lol! The security features built in to this router are worth the money alone.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Great powerful router !!!  A+ ... Mesh router or this one or both ??? Read this ---
customer_reviews.text: This router covers my 4000+ SQ FT. house plus more. I tried to go to a Mesh router but half of my devices would not work with Mesh (Known problem). A router extender worked but it was messy to use. So... I looked for the most powerful router that could cover the area on its own. No extender or mesh. This router works! I have a WIFI switch over 100 feet from the router and it works fine. We have over 30 devices using this router and it works fine. Can not say enough about this router ... very nice. (Note: ASUS says that I can Mesh this router but not needed.)
customer_reviews.author: CCrow

customer_reviews.title: Fast internet with good reception throughout house(s)
customer_reviews.text: I got this high speed router to go with my new house, which had Fiber internet. With fiber internet being much faster than cable, I wanted faster router. With a house rather than a small apartment, I wanted better reception. I have been very happy with this router, to the extent that I bought a second identical one for my parents’ (larger) house, which had long had reception troubles - previously needed to use a WiFi repeater. This router provides strong reception throughout that house, even without the repeater. Couldn’t be happier with it. Again, liked it so much I bought a second for my parents house.
customer_reviews.author: bacinci

customer_reviews.title: Worked great from Oct 2018 to January 2020.
customer_reviews.text: Just like the title states, this use to work great. However now the wifi shuts off every 20 to 30 minutes or so. I have to power cycle it to get another 20-30 minutes. My xbox (which is wired) works normally. I've reset it twice with no success. I spent the money on a Netgear Nighthawk, and that beefy bad boy can handle the 20-30 devices in our home like it's nothing. I should've got that to begin with, but wanted to save a few dollars so I ended up with this one. Learn from my mistake (and countless others on here saying the same thing) and skip this one.
customer_reviews.author: WA7S0N

customer_reviews.title: I love mine!
customer_reviews.text: Pro tip: flash your router with AsusWRT Merlin to unlock true potential. I'm really enjoying mine. The only complaint I have is that every once in a while the web interface crashes and I have to reboot router. I might just schedule nightly reboots to avoid having to deal with that. Other than that, it's awesome. The iPhone app that comes with it is also surprisingly good.
customer_reviews.author: Dean D.

customer_reviews.title: 2.4 GHz completely unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Just Google "RT-AC86U 2.4" and take a look a the results. The 2.4GHz network never worked reliably. It would just drop periodically. Now it won't broadcast it at all. I've tried flashing it, factory reset, updating firmware, several combinations of configurations and cannot get it to work. If you have any older devices, like a Kindle Paperwhite or Apple TV, be warned. While it says "dual band" the 2.4 GHz band is essentially useless.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, worthless warranty, does not work
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this as a premium router for nearly $200 and, long story short, I've ended up switching to a $50 router that works just as well. This thing was nearly as unreliable as the customer service that ASUS provided when it broke. I've had to send it in twice, and I'm still waiting on the 2nd repair (one month later). I'm not even sure ASUS will ever return the router. Avoid this nightmare at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Z. Freedman

customer_reviews.title: Would be great if it was reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using ASUS RT-AC68 routers for years, with rMerlin firmware (only way to go). I thought the RT-AC86 was the next big thing, but they fail randomly, particularly the 2.4 GHz wifi. I've had one go out completely and one go flaky -- only fails once in a while. And once in a while on reboot they go into a weird power-off mode, need a power cycle to recover. Which isn't a big deal unless you schedule a reboot or are supporting it remotely. Warranty "service" from ASUS is a joke. They make it so hard and complicated and time-consuming that it isn't worth bothering. I'm switching to Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Jim

customer_reviews.title: Good coverage, easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: My asus rt-ac66U router recently died so I needed a replacement. Having had good experience with asus, I decided ont eh RT-AC86U. Out of the box, it's easy to setup. Plug in the power, WAN cable from my cable modem and onto the UI for a quick setup. After setup, I tested the usual trouble spots and surprisingly they were no longer there. This router had better coverage than my previous one and now I can remove a repeater I had setup. Good thing about this router is that I can either use the ASUS firmware or the Merlin modified version. I highly recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic-strong solid router
customer_reviews.text: Have had 3 Netgear routers before this Asus. The Netgear served me well. However, the range of my Netgear 6400 was waning. After MUCH research I decided on this router. I love everything about it. The range is great. A nice customizable router. I have had no drops whatsoever. I run computers , NAS, printers, and security camera system and this ASUS router never even hiccups. Can't rate customer service as I have not needed to contact them. I love this router so far and highly recommend if you are thinking of buying a new router.
customer_reviews.author: Dan & Robin

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy: 2.4 GHz radio is flaky. Many reports of the same issue all over the internet.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! Many have reported the problem i have: The 2.4 GHz stops working at random. Resets and firmware upgrades are no help solving this. Your devices that don't have 5 GHz will fail to connect, though the WiFi looks fine. ASUS continues to completely ignore the service tickets I open. If I could give a zero-stars rating, I would.
customer_reviews.author: SetDancer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: 5ghz stops working until you reboot the router. I can access the external drive but it doesn't allow to write to the drive. So if you want to add files you need to unplug it, move it to your computer, add the files, plug it back into the router. Ive searched for days to find a solution but nothing works.
customer_reviews.author: Steven M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and lots of security options
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup. The manufacturer keeps the software updated. I bought it because it allows me to have more security options than my old router for which no update has been available for the last nine years despite all the security breaches that have been in the news. Saving the settings is easy and uploading them works perfectly as I discovered after the recommendation by the FBI that people make sure they check for updates and restart at a minimum and preferably reset to factory default settings and then reapplying one's personal settings. I'm extremely concerned about identity theft as well as all the threats of foreign interference.
customer_reviews.author: wifi-er

customer_reviews.title: Works until it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: Bought it and it ran for 2 months, and then it wouldn't connect and could no longer be discovered. Asus support was unhelpful, asked basic questions, no solutions that weren't more advanced than 30 seconds of Googling. End result is now I have to pay to ship it to Asus so they can fix it and send it back, probably 3 weeks later. All told I will not be buying Asus products again and not buying similar products on Amazon. I could fix the problem tonight if I could bring it back to the place I bought it and get a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Fast, reliable, easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before by this. I needed a wifi router that could handle a ton of devices, some using high bandwidth. My internet provide delivers consistent 200+mbps to my house so this fit the bill. Sometimes we have two xbox ones going, multiple google homes, Netflix on the TV and a couple of smartphones at the same time! Doesn't even phase this router. We have a smaller two story home but signal is strong anywhere in a yard too. Easy set up, reliable, intuitive dashboard to set it up (if you choose not to stick with the default settings). I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: StuTX

customer_reviews.title: Worked for one year and died.  Worse deal than renting from the internet provider. Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a little over a year and completely died. Fair signal while it worked but now is another piece of dysfunctional electronic trash to poison the Earth. Tried to use ASUS's recovery app. The app claimed to work and the power button stopped flashing. Once reboot, it went back to flashing and doesn't do anything, couldn't connect to it to even get into the settings, totally dead.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: I love Asus products,  but with this issue I’ll be breaking up with them!
customer_reviews.text: After doing extensive research in the SOHO router world, I finally settled on this unit due to feature set/price. It has worked great, up until yesterday when i completely died. In working with support they determined that there is faulty hardware, and I will have to ship the unit to them to fix at cost to myself with no time frame on it being returned. Luckily I work in the IT field, so I have a spare router, but most people don't. Sadly after this unit dies, I will no long be able to support ASUS as a result of how they handle supporting a critical piece of equipment that my household relies on.
customer_reviews.author: skeets

customer_reviews.title: AiMesh for the win
customer_reviews.text: Due to construction and configuration we've always used two seperate wifi routers to cover our property. That meant lots of manual switching between them to get the best signal in any particular spot. Two of these, using an ethernet connection between them, have made our lives that much easier. It's worked flawlessly and devices have moved to the optimum node smoothly. The only issue we've had after several months was the need to restart the child node after an evening where we saw several power outages.
customer_reviews.author: dkh

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk Stopped Working In Less Than A Week
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't be so upset if this had been a cheap home router, but noooo...I had to get "the best." It worked GREAT! For a week. Then it started dropping the Internet. I am using it as an access point, and I guess that they don't want me doing that. I'm going to send back what I have. I no longer have the manuals or boxes, so I expect them to give me a hard time. As this is a corporate purchase, it would be a shame to have to write it down, but I can live with it, if that's what's needed. I'm replacing it with some cheap stuff that I'll get later today at Best Buy. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Little Green Viper

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t hold up. Worthless repair attempt.
customer_reviews.text: This worked really well, and I was satisfied with it.......for a while. Then it simply died 14 months later. Tech support said send it in for warranty repair, at my expense. Two weeks later I got it back and it won’t connect to the internet. Calls to tech support were more annoying then useful. It’s in the trash now.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Reno

customer_reviews.title: Awesome AiMesh Network Node!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big ASUS guy, especially when it comes to their WiFi routers. I have the RT-AC88U and then I added this one: the RT-AC86U to create an ASUS AiMesh network. Admitedly, I'm a bit of a techie but still, this was really easy to set up and it has eliminated every dead spot in my 3,000SF, 4-story townhouse. I watched the YouTube videos and downloaded the manual in advance of getting the RT-AC86U but; upon arrival and plugging it into my computer, it configured itself (essentially). If you've already got an AiMesh compatible ASUS router and you want to create a mesh-network than this is your device.
customer_reviews.author: Amanaude

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so I could install the Mesh features and get rid of wifi weak spots in the house. Following the instructions is essential to success, which I am pleased to say I did follow instructions and the upgrade went smoothly. I especially like the ease of assigning static IP addresses. And the ease in which my clients simply and effortlessly attach to the closest router for optimal signal. Only nit downers: I just wish there was an export feature to export my static ip address / device name / mac address list. And a way to wall mount the router, to get the thing off my desk / shelf and out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Why Fi

customer_reviews.title: 100% reliable. Strong router.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace my linksys router, which was a constant headache. 10 months so far and never had to restart it. I get a strong signal on all three floors of my house. This router still manages to give me 80 mbps on an ookla speed test 60 feet or so into my backyard. I put a bunch of movies for my kids on an external hard drive and the media server is easy for them to find their movies on a fire stick. Overall 10/10. Would recommend. Would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: Easily setup using a web browser Replaced still functioning RT-AC 68U. Bought as a backup for the 68U. I had to put the new router in service to test that it worked It has identical coverage and throughput as the older router-so decided to leave it in place and keep the RT-AC68U as the backup. TIP- After you've done your initial setup and changed the user name and password instruct the router to go online and check for the latest firmware update. If you like to experiment.with some of the advanced settings it is easy to create a backup configuration file to enable you to restore your previous settings.
customer_reviews.author: BOB

customer_reviews.title: Really like this router
customer_reviews.text: I had the lower model RT-AC68U and upgraded to this router and used the old one as an extender using AiMesh. This router is strong and my reception improved enough that I probably didn't need the extender. I did it anyway and the mesh setup was extremely simple. The firmware also seems better on this model as my old router had some quirks in the setup. I would suggest this model over the the lesser models. It was worth the price. Only quirk I had with the mesh is the extender doesn't support the guest network. Both 2G and 5G work on both routers, but the guest is only on the primary router.
customer_reviews.author: DWK

customer_reviews.title: One of the best I've had especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: There are some great features that come with this router. I'm not a big WiFi fan, but you have great security on your internal WiFi bands and can allow guest access with restrictions very easily. There are too many features to list. But I like the ability to set user MAC address as a requirement for access. The router works with Spectrum. It supports at least 25 Mb/s down, and 12.5 Mb/s up. That's my limit, and there are claims of 40x faster speeds. It will support Mesh router networking. If you have to cover a broad area, deal with security issues, or just need to proved solid WiFi everywhere, you will want this feature.
customer_reviews.author: Hoser

customer_reviews.title: Short Life Span
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router in July 2018 and it was a great AC router while it lasted. Great coverage and speedy. After a year and a half the 2.4ghz band started sporadically dropping connections and then completely died. A couple month's later the same think happened with the 5ghz band. Had to upgrade to an AX router sooner then planned due to the short life of this router. Had hoped to use this router as an AiMesh node when I did upgrade but that plan is out the window now. Don't know what the typical life span of a router is but I would think it should be longer then 18 months, am I wrong?
customer_reviews.author: Franco

customer_reviews.title: Everything you could want in a performance Router
customer_reviews.text: First time buying ASUS after being previous owners of Netgear/Linksys/Cisco routers over past 20 years. ASUS has a great Management Console UI, reliable and top notch fast speed. Customizable WiFI settings with anything and everything you might need regarding WiFi security options. Easy to understand and well though out interface. Don't laugh but they even ha a phone app, which at first might sound silly, but is well designed and extremely useful allowing you to monitor connectivity, connected devices, etc. all from your phone. This is an absolute winner here and PC Magazine got it right with Editor Rating of 4.00 - Excellent for one of the best routers of 2018.
customer_reviews.author: Moose

customer_reviews.title: Avoid for using wifi. Units with faulty wifi hardware common
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router because so many tech websites and online reviews recommended it due to its above average 1.8ghz clock single core performance and built-in openvpn support; both features I was looking for in a wifi router this time around. Unfortunately, when I received the router, the 2.4ghz wifi band did not work. Tried resetting, updating firmware, and reflashing firmware. Nothing fixed it. Then I noticed other 1-2 star reviews on here stating the same issue. It did work well otherwise and there was a noticeable improvement in VPN performance. I have since returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely cranks Wi-Fi signal through the house. No deadzones in a medium-sized home.
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the TP M5 Deco's, and they were complete trash. This single router has absolutely patched up all the deadzones in my house. It is a networking specialists dream with the amount of options it has. The apps on the phone are handy for checking what devices are connected, and what is using what. It has a ton of diagnostic information, and lots of security settings, along with built protections against the nasties of the internet. If this holds up a few years from now, I'll be hard pressed to ever recommend anything other than this router.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Howard

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I had this plugged in about a month and the 2.5 Ghz band stopped working. For most people that might not be a problem, but I have a device that requires the 2.5 band. I ended up plugging in the old ASUS I had for years again. Not sure what I'm going to do. the 5 ghz seems to work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Clapp

customer_reviews.title: Must read before buying.
customer_reviews.text: Just like other reviewers, I got this router and WiFi keeps dropping and my old 68u works fine. Called ASUS care said I have to pay for shipping. They found nothing wrong and sent back. This router do not work. I am shocked to see a big company like ASUS can’t stand behind there product. BUT. I did get another 86u and wanted to see if same issues happen. And they did. It must be a software issue or the just don’t make reliable router anymore. Be warned do not buy. I will update if any changes happen with firmware updates. At this time I will keep using my 68u
customer_reviews.author: Juan J. Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Just love the product, use VPN all the time and I upgraded to Merlin
customer_reviews.text: ! Love the product while it worked, now the 5GHZ and 2.4 Ghz are useless - I reset the unit to default and started anew - all devices connect to the WIFI but no internet is available to the them - upgraded to the latest firmware and still not working - my desktop is the only one working on this "great wifi" router - kinda of useless as it took my network down - ASUS chat and warranty is useless - OMG who do I turn to to get this fixed????
customer_reviews.author: Dr. James "Bond" von Richthofen Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Fixed Traffic Issues
customer_reviews.text: We had plenty of bandwidth but our old netgear could not manage all the traffic. We have four people with four devices each, plus TV, security system, home office VPN phone, and probably a couple other things I forgot. This manages traffic much better and manages downloads very well. No issues, and a life saver now that we all are working and schooling from home.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Mcfeely

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup, Great Performance
customer_reviews.text: Just set up the new router and it was a breeze. Everyone immediately hoped on the WiFi when it came back up, but the new unit still gives my Desktop Workstation 2x to 3x the speedtest numbers the old one typically did. Of course, I bought the old one in 2014, and it was dated then. AC2900's the performance doesn't degrade with two dozen devices like my old one did. Really nice User Interface: Simple to understand, but with all the tweaks, tools and diagnostics built in. I didn't have to call tech support, but I gave the AC2900 a five because of the UI.
customer_reviews.author: LESchwartz

customer_reviews.title: Best router I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Between the speed, range, network management, app, and aesthetics, this is by far the best router I've owned. WiFi speeds on 5GHz with an 802.11AC adapter are amazing. There was even a point where I switched from CAT5 ethernet to 802.11AC WiFi, and the speeds were FASTER!! The app is very simple and intuitive, but powerful. I've used a couple other routers in my 2400sqft house, and there isn't a corner that even 5GHz doesn't reach, where the other routers fell short. I'd recommend this router to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Borsalino A.

customer_reviews.title: Wifi drop frequently
customer_reviews.text: The cable connection is OK but the Wifi is unstable and has frequent drop signals. There are around 10-15 devices connected to the wifi router at a time (considering that they are not overloaded). My house is small and all appliances with a radius of 25 ' I tried to change different channels instead of auto but still no luck.
customer_reviews.author: Camnhung Tran

customer_reviews.title: Horrible support and poor connectivity for older devices
customer_reviews.text: Hard line connection was very fast, but I was never able to connect my older devices (2-3 years old) to the WiFi connection. I contacted support numerous times and they always gave me the same solution. Nothing they told me worked because they gave me instructions for either the wrong router or an older version. The screen shots and instructions did not match my router. Eventually the instructions they gave me corrupted the firmware making it unusable. I will never buy an Asus router again. Going back to Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn K.

customer_reviews.title: WiFi Dead On Arrival Or Shortly Thereafter
customer_reviews.text: I tried 3 of these before I gave up. The first lasted less then a week before the 5Ghz band died and then the router started a continuous reboot cycle, on the 2nd and 3rd (I am a slow learner) the 2.4Ghz band was DEAD out of the box. I tried factory reset, updated firmware and no response. There is something seriously wrong with the current crop of this router. I have one of these routers that I bought in September 2018 and it has been rock solid, that is the reason I decided to get another to use as an access point. Will not buy again until Asus finds and fixes the problem with the router.
customer_reviews.author: MRS

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from ASUS routers
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot of other users - the 2.4G radio failed early. Couple that with other weird issues like it suddenly would not accept fixed DHCP assignments. It allowed a couple right at the beginning, but then refused to add a third one. Firmware updates did not fix problem. Based on other reviews, I'm done with ASUS products. Thank goodness Amazon is so good about returns. But now I have to find a replacement from another vendor.

customer_reviews.title: Good and stable router with Merlin firmware
customer_reviews.text: Probably my fifth Asus router in many years. To further improve home wifi stability, I decided to upgrade to this router early, although the previous AC68U was still functioning well. Load merlin firmware was easy and straightforward. Compare to AC68U, the CPU load was much lower, reflecting a more powerful CPU. However no significant boost to wifi coverage in house. A big disappointment. Stability wise I have achieved my goal. Only need to reboot once for the USB printer issue.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne C.

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 of these to "Mesh"
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a Netgear Nighthawk R7000 for years now and was very pleased with it. So I bought a E7000 extender as well. But shortly after that, Netgear firmware updates became very unstable and constantly caused me to roll back to an much older versions just to keep things somewhat stable and operational. So after months of issues and no apparent end in sight of the issues being corrected, I bought two ASUS 86u routers and setup a mesh network. Not only are my overall speeds now better than my previous setup, but MUCH more stable as well. Should have done this months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Grover517

customer_reviews.title: When it works, it works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: So I'm a fan of Acer and Amazon warehouse. Lots of reviews with issues of the 2.4ghz band. Ordered a good condition one and was working fine for a couple of weeks and then it began to fail. Ethernet and 5ghz was fine but I need a product that works completely. Got a better replacement and so far so good. Apparently these tend to overheat so I got some cooling fans for $20. Asus routers work really well. This router works really well and AI Mesh does too. Just a shame that there are quality control issues.
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: I gave up on AIMEsh
customer_reviews.text: After almost a year of trying to keep AIMesh functional I gave up and made this an access point. Aimesh is not ready for regular use. It got slower and slower and slower with every update over the past year. You are much better off using them with as a wired access point. About 10 times better speed as an access point than as an aimesh node. As one use wrote, you could spend 30 days just trying settings options trying to make it work, it just doesn't work well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trust me - This is the Router to get.
customer_reviews.text: For anyone looking for a great router for a 2 story home. This is the one to get. After purchasing a NetGear router and having problems with the reception, I did my research and purchased the ASUS AC2900 and the family and I have been extremely happy with this router. I'm sure you can purchase some that are twice the price but take it from a very satisfied customer. This baby does the job and their customer service is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Wfgng

customer_reviews.title: 2.4Ghz dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Bought a "renewed" Asus AC2900 here from Amazon. As soon as I powered the device on the 2.4Ghz band did not work. It showed up in the gui and working but none of my devices could see the 2.4Ghz band being broadcast. 5Ghz band was fine, it was the 2.4Ghz band that was non functioning right from the get go. Updated to the latest firmware, reset to factory settings, power cycled several times and nothing would fix the issue. Come to find out that many have had the same issue as I for the Asus AC2900. Shame, looked like a good router too. Returning for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: kingdaddydong

customer_reviews.title: 2.4ghz Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: 2.4ghz band didn't work. GUI barely stable. Returned. Edit: I bought a pre-owned one from somebody (outside of Amazon) and the router is awesome. I'm running Merlin on it. I think Amazon was selling re-furbs when I bought my original one because there were a lot of bad reviews that I saw with similar issues to the original one I bought.
customer_reviews.author: K. Harper

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Asus routers at home for years, love the admin interface and reliability. This "upgrade" has been anything but: I get consistent wifi drops from a few devices (those devices had no issues with the previous Asus router, different NICs made no change), four weeks of awful tech support has gotten me no where. I debugged some issues on my own parsing logs, sent them specific errors looking for input, no luck. Useless replies, I have no doubt 10 minutes with a competent tech would have solved the problem. Back it goes, avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Broke after three months of use.
customer_reviews.text: The router setup fine and worked for the first three months requiring a restart every few weeks. After three months it stopped broadcasting the 2.4 Ghz SSID daily. Restarting it would fix it for a day or two, but then it would happen again. Tried factory reset, and the problems continued. I purchased a Netgear Nighthawk to replace it which has been a much better experience. Very disappointed it cannot be exchanged within the first year.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Dead in less than 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the ASUS AC2900 Router on August 10, 2018. On July 1, 2020 it was completely dead and non-responsive. Up to then, the router was just ok. I had to do quite a bit of adjustments to get all our devices to connect. Also had to do the usual quarterly or monthly rebooting. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: 2.4 signal overheats. Use fans!
customer_reviews.text: AC2900 heats up much more than AC1900. 2.4 signal breaks down even in a cool cement basement ~ 58 deg.F You could simply lay device face down and set two small fans on top of back vent. The only other venting is at the top and would end up parallel with a table top or shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Easadude

customer_reviews.title: You want and awesome Wireless router replacement???. ASUS RT AC86U.
customer_reviews.text: JMZ Command Central.......Updated.... You want and awesome Wireless router replacement???. ASUS RT AC86U. Streaming. Gaming, w/ extended range (5000' radius), and network protection for all your wi-fi devices. Very customizable. Another awesome product from ASUS! Tested. Everything advertised and better!! Replaced an ASUS AC56U dual band (which was awesome, as well, in its time). The upgrade difference in speed, connectivity, and range was definitely a significant leap. Streaming is fantastic! No Lag or dropped streams. Picture and log-in takes moments. 10 plus devices on wi-fi. Great job (as usual) ASUS!!!
customer_reviews.author: John F. Fowlds Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Don't fall for the tech reviews
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Netgear Nighthawk that was developing connection issues and USB issues. Read a bunch of reviews that this was one of the best routers of 2019. This has been nothing but hours of frustration. The set up instructions that come with it and that are online are useless. I'm no IT guy, but can do basic stuff and have on Netgear and Linksys routers without this kind of frustration. Don't know if this a good router or not, cannot get it to work consistently enough to tell. If you're a network pro it might be great, just be warned it's not easy to set up or keep working.
customer_reviews.author: Browns532

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Product was great until it stopped working after 6 month. Then i found out that the product is covered by warranty only in north america. Who sells a product internationally when he knows that there's no warranty for it. Anyways, i tried to use the warranty through them "tunny llc", meaning, i'll send it to them and they will send to the manufacturer, but they refused to do it, as if they have zero resposibility for the product they sold. Anyways, now it's a very expensive paper weight. Buy at your own risk, and don't expect any help from the seller
customer_reviews.author: Arnon

customer_reviews.title: 86u is an awesome router. The UI and features are much more advanced than others.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome router. The UI and features are much more advanced than Netgear, Linksys and Dlink. I have a 4000 sq ft house and there is good connection everywhere. I also have 30 devices connected with 2 of them streaming HD content and there is no buffering anywhere. Update 1/1/2019 - With merlin firmware installed, this thing is going strong with me still with no issues and solid coverage.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Yoda

customer_reviews.title: Works far off for my wifi cameras
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to provide coverage for my Blink Xt2 cameras I have eight cameras and one is a good 90 feet away at my driveway gate. The directions were not that clear but I figured it out. Im not good at computer tech but the interface seems pretty easy to use. Like adding another mesh router and allowing guest access. I don't plan to use it to its full capability. I've owned it a couple months and have not had any outages where I had to reset it like other routers.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Huge Improvement Over Modem
customer_reviews.text: I realize any aftermarket router would be an improvement over an Xfinity Modem, but this went above and beyond. The wifi in our 2 bedroom apartment was obsolete. The modem was/is about 4 feet on the other side of the wall from our tv. Netflix/Amazon/Youtube all lose signal fairly often. After installing and setting up this router, we logged into the new wifi signal generated from the router, and we noticed the apps functioned a lot faster, and we (after 1 month of having it) have not had a loading screen or break in connection since. We also have had 2 phones, the tv, and 2 laptops connected at the same time, with no lagging. I highly recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Justus

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a month or so
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for one month, then it suddenly stopped transmitting the 2.4ghz band and I noticed it like 1 month later since most of my hardware runs on 5ghz. Didn't actually tried that hard to troubleshoot, and once I tried to "fix it" I noticed that the 5Ghz was running worse Didn't tried Asus support since most of the reviews here says that they dont work as expected, so...
customer_reviews.author: Falcon

customer_reviews.title: Device died after one year use
customer_reviews.text: This device was professionally surge protected on all connected cables and devices: power and Ethernet. The power supply failed: shuts down seconds after turning on. No product support found after one-year warranty from date of purchase. Get a more durable product.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C Brown

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Decent Little Router
customer_reviews.text: So, I've had this router for about a year and 15 days. It works fairly decently. I hate the app interface, and the web interface is ok, but I've decided to upgrade for some more advanced stuff that starts with a U so I can institute VLANs and some other more advanced features on my home network. If you are looking for a good home router and don't know networking, this router is a great option. If you are a nerd like me and want to do some more advanced networking stuff, there are better, but much more expensive options.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: 2.4Ghz Radio Broken
customer_reviews.text: As many others have mentioned, the 2.4Ghz on this router broke after some time. I was lucky to have mine last a year and 4 months where many others had theirs break right away. From what I've heard about Asus support, I don't imagine I'll get anything from them, but I'll try to make a warranty claim. Either way, I wouldn't want to use this router ever again. When it was working, the 5Ghz speeds were great, but the other features and interface this router offered were mediocre at best. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Tryon

customer_reviews.title: Bricked after 14 days of use
customer_reviews.text: Based on my previous ASUS experience (a desktop built by me using an ASUS motherboard in 2003 and still running perfectly today), and the large number of positive reviews, I bought this router. And it worked fine until it didn't work at all. Would not reset to factory defaults and lost its login ID and password. Perhaps I should have read more of the less positive reviews. Seems as thought success in the tech world leads to deteriorating products for the consumer.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrie A. Coleman

customer_reviews.title: 1st one was a dud, 2nd one TBD.
customer_reviews.text: Dead after a couple days use. First lost the 2.4 GHz WiFi, logged into Router and all settings looked fine. Rebooted from within user interface and that's when the fun started. Router got stuck in what appeared to be a boot loop. Tried holding reset button for 5+ seconds, power cycled etc. Back it goes to Amazon. Return process was painless. New one arrives today. Going to try a 2nd one in the hopes that I got a lemon. Too many good reviews to give up after one bad apple. Will update after a few weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: Larry S.

customer_reviews.title: does not seem to handle Quality of Service at full gigabit speeds
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router based on reviews that said it would do QoS at full gigabit speeds, but in my tests so far this does not seem to be the case, there's a pretty big performance penalty. I've got a mail in to tech support but they're very slow to respond, but hopefully they can figure out what the deal is. Until then, it seems great as a general router and wifi access point, but it can't handle QoS at gigabit speeds, so I'm giving it three stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2.4 ghz signal is sporadic at best.
customer_reviews.text: The router worked ok even if my WiFi was a bit laggy at first. After a week my devices stopped connecting to the 2.4 ghz signal even though the router was broadcasting the signal. I did a factory reset and that got it working for about 12 hours. After that every 6 to 12 hours my devices would again not be able to connect and I'd have to reboot the router. 5 ghz worked albeit by being a bit laggy. I ended up getting an ax1500 tp link router that is absolutely rock solid with no lagging or disconnections. If you value your time don't buy this router!
customer_reviews.author: Steve C

customer_reviews.title: no or little support
customer_reviews.text: Instructions provided were no help in setting up the router. It was replacing a Netgear which worked fine, but not as fast. After several days of working with customer service, I finally was able to get the ASUS set up. Unfortunately, another reset was needed a few months later, and again the unit would not set up and customer service was not available on the weekend. Have gone back to the Netgear Nighthawk. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Blazing fast and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Our old router died and we replaced it with this one. We are very, VERY pleased. Our download speed was always good, but now it's ~20% better. We have 5 people online almost all day and have not had bandwidth or connection issues. It was very easy to set up, though I wasn't able to set the exact same passwords so we had to reconnect everything. But I'm pretty sure it was user error, not the instructions. Great Router!!
customer_reviews.author: LIBBR8R

customer_reviews.title: Overall it works great
customer_reviews.text: I got the wireless router since my 2 in 1 was slow so I got this and it works much better stand alone, I can manage what is running in my router and prioritize if I need to, it shows me a report when it protects and I can turn off the wifi if I need to. family members and guest members options too. Had to get used to using it, software could be easier to use but overall good value and has been working great,
customer_reviews.author: AngelM

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good in 2020
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so not everything about this year has been great, but, after a few days of use, I'm happy with this router. The range is great, and the user interface is easy to navigare with plenty of features for advanced users. I'm running a VPN through it, which this router is excellent for. I know prior iterations had issues with the 2.4Ghz radio transmitters dying, and I will update this review if I experience any issues with my unit.
customer_reviews.author: TeaJay

customer_reviews.title: Lost 5 Ghz after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, upgrade the FW, and even with Merlin. The coverage is great with a 2500 sq home and 23 clients connected. The dual wifi signals are strong. There are lots of settings I could try. The bad thing is a changing setting will cause rebooting the unit which is annoying, and the worst is that after 2 weeks, it lost 5g wifi, rebooting may bring back and lost again later. Luckily still in return window.
customer_reviews.author: PeterC

customer_reviews.title: DOA from warehouse deals
customer_reviews.text: Bought this from Amazon Warehouse Deals. 2.4 ghz band stopped working within 10 minutes of initial setup. I was eventually able to get the 2.4 ghz radio working again after two days and hours of trying, and it stopped working again after an hour of functionality. There were a ridiculous amount of problems besides that. 5ghz intermittent, GUI wouldn't load in my browser. Warehouse Deals is definitely sending out some funky units. I'd guess this was probably a defective return amazon decided to resell.
customer_reviews.author: A. Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Coverage Galore!
customer_reviews.text: The AC86U is really easy to setup. One router provided (top floor) more than enough coverage for a two story + basement extending detached garage 62 feet away and front sidewalk at 27 feet. Signal is passing through steel roof and stucco. I installed the second AC86U as a node for AIMesh and to attach all the server / Sonos / etc stuff I don't want on display. I hate clutter and this device delivered high quality signal, massive coverage and versatility in setup. Love it so far. I did purchase the 4 year plan. We all know today's merchandise is a far cry from what is actually high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kassandra

customer_reviews.title: Only a 5.0 band router
customer_reviews.text: Everything said about the 2.4 band on this router is true. I can safely say that after 4 days of fighting this thing, I’m sending it back. Disclaimer, The app and the 5.0 band are great. Fast with good range. I planned to have all my smart home devices on the 2.4 band, that was a mistake. The 2.4 band refused to connect with many of my devices, and once connected after a few hours they would go offline and need to be set up from scratch again. This is a consumer product, so I shouldn’t need a degree in electrical engineering to get it to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great router. Easy setup. Fast speeds
customer_reviews.text: I went from an Asus 56u, to a nighthawk r7000 AC1900. I’ve always been happy with netgear but my recent upgrade to Xfinity gigabit did not play well with the netgear router. After a lot of research I decided on the Asus ac2900. Set up was very simple and I love the GUI interface. I was up and running in minutes. Speed test went from 700 on the netgear to 940 on the Asus. My wireless speeds doubled throughout the house. We have upwards of 10 things connected and no hiccups.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bagenski

customer_reviews.title: Easy, fast, and great  range
customer_reviews.text: The router is super easy to set up. the range is great. The most difficult area in my place is my back deck with a brick wall. I only lose about10% of my speed. I pay for 250 megabits and score well north of 325 most of the time. It's impossible to tell if it is the router or RCN being sloppy on the speed cap. Regardless, I highly recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew RM

customer_reviews.title: best router, fast, great protection, aimesh is fast
customer_reviews.text: I have used only Asus routers at my homes and when I set them up for friends. Lots of features, great user interface, great app. East to remote connect. I'm using two in my current home, with the second as a wired Access Point. You can do it wirelessly, but running a cat wire between them gives you so much more speed. The free anti malicious site blocker is worth $200 a year, and it comes free!
customer_reviews.author: Villager Mike

customer_reviews.title: Extra security and all traffic VPN options
customer_reviews.text: ASUS has a magnificent router with the 86U! Signal strength is superb, we have 2 units in a 2500 sqft house. I needed 2 because we all walls filled with foam, siding, decking, etc all have aluminum thermal barriers. I flashed the latest Merlin OS to get options I need. The AiMesh with openvpn provides strong signals to all Firesticks and other devices. The ASUS 86U is a strong unit for our home business and guest with WiFi networks.
customer_reviews.author: Dean T

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me..(AC2900)
customer_reviews.text: I have owned and used several Asus wireless routers over the years. I upgraded to the AC2900 from the AC1900 that still worked great.. The wifi range and speed is why I choose Asus. I have owned my AC2900 for a year now with no problems. My AC2900 provides smooth coverage to 2300 Sq ft. The setup of the router is easy and the user settings are abundant.. I would recommend the AC1900 or the AC2900.
customer_reviews.author: Cpr178

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I've been using an Asus RT-N66U router for 3-4 years now and have been happy with it. I decided to try this router to see if gaming would be better (and I needed a router for another residence). I was very disappointed to see my wireless AND wired ping go from the mid 20's with the N66U to the mid 30's (!!!) with this router. Really? I saw this replicated across an iPhone 11 Pro Max, iPad Pro, MacBook Pro, and a 1 year old windoze laptop. The upload and download bandwidths were nearly identical between the two routers, but there's no way I'm paying this price for a 35% INCREASE in ping. It's going back. Bummer...
customer_reviews.author: peloton

customer_reviews.title: 2.4GHz stopped working
customer_reviews.text: 2.4GHz stopped working a few days later the router died. Good while it last, but it didn't last long enough.
customer_reviews.author: bisenberger

customer_reviews.title: 2.4 ghz wifi stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviews have stated, My unit stopped broadcasting the 2.4 ghz wifi. After factory default/software update, the unit went into a boot loop. Currently in process of RMAing this unit to the manufacturer, but i'm unsure if the repaired unit / replacement would make any long term difference seeing as so many on here have had the same issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2.4 ghz does not work
customer_reviews.text: Normally I love Asus routers. I have purchased many of them in the past, and all my older routers work great. My brand new RT-AC86U lost the capability to transmit and receive on 2.4 ghz within days of my installing it. Apparently this is a common problem, and no one seems to know how to turn it back on. Unfortunately, I didn't realize the 2.4 ghz function had failed until after the return window had closed. All the other features work fine. Unfortunately I have a few devices, a tablet, multiple thermostats and a Nook that only use 2.4 ghz.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Crossfire

customer_reviews.title: Very unstable
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why people give this router such a high score. The quality is simply unreliable. The router reboots more than 10 times today. The UI is trash. The device list constantly clears out and then pops up one by one. The USB printer setup is complicated and not user-friendly. The printer constantly disconnects and the router needs a reboot to put the printer online. I am not longer trusting Asus on any product. The Aimesh is not stable. Once it's disconnected, you have to manually reboot the router to reconnect.
customer_reviews.author: min

customer_reviews.title: Great router with Merlin firmware
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router for about 2 years. It has a great range, amble bandwidth, and an easy to navigate interface. At first, it would drop out temporary at least once a day. This stopped after I uploaded the Merlin firmware. Now that Merlin supports Asus mesh, I believe it has all the functionality of the prior functionality. I also use it for cloud storage and am able to access any USB storage plugged into the router from anywhere I have an internet connection. This router should be all you need if you live in a one story home with ~3 bedrooms. I docked a star since the router would temporarily drop out until uploading Merlin.
customer_reviews.author: L Pete E Jr.

customer_reviews.title: 5 Ghz radio just stopped working after 5 months of light use.
customer_reviews.text: 5 Ghz radio just stopped working after 5 months of light use. After doing a factory reset and a tons of troubleshooting, I have an expensive router that only has a 2.4 Ghz radio band. Thanks Asus!
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: Leave a lot to be desired
customer_reviews.text: To start easy set up much like other routers. But now it starts rebooting randomly like others have said. Have had this router since Nov 2018. Also range leaves alot to be desired. I have gig net and it seems the router can have multiple devices streaming and gaming at once. Almost like the router gets congested for some reason. Poor showing from asus on this one
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, Excellent Customer Support!  Extremely Satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second ASUS router! The setup was a breeze! The ASUS AC2900 has AiMesh which makes it easy to add another ASUS AiMesh router to it to cover the home with Wifi to eliminate weak areas. I owned an ASUS AC1750 router (AiMesh) and added it to the ASUS AC2900 which was easy! ASUS tech support provided very easy details and walked me through the simple process. I highly recommend the ASUS AC2900 with AiMesh!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis W

customer_reviews.title: Frequent disconnections and packet loss
customer_reviews.text: Frequent disconnections and packet loss. Not sure if I just got a bad one but because the problem is intermittent it's extremely difficult to troubleshoot with Asus. It's easier to just get a different router. I can't recommend this router. I actually had an AC1750 and it worked great for a long time. I upgraded to this one but it has not been as reliable. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Wong

customer_reviews.title: This WiFi router is awesome but there’s something to adress....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router because my old one was slow but it took me a day to get it to work. So if you end up buying it, it’s five stars. But your going to need to get your WiFi company’s ip so you can connect you WiFi to them and your going to need to update the firmware. Also customer support was a bitch for the router so don’t even try. Just look it up on YouTube. From their on out your WiFi will run great just make sure you customized it to work great for your devices.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. D.

customer_reviews.title: Good performance and coverage area
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a previous (68U) ASUS router, and this one improved coverage in my house. I was going to MESH network, but this unit signal strength is strong enough that I don't need to.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Pez

customer_reviews.title: ASUS AC2900 Garbage
customer_reviews.text: The unit is supposed to great for "gaming", but I have encountered nothing but drops, disconnects and problems for the past 6 months. I recently had a Firmware update for the unit and now it randomly disconnects itself from the internet almost every other day. Will never buy one of these again.
customer_reviews.author: Foxtrot010

customer_reviews.title: Asus is tops
customer_reviews.text: I own a 5 year old AC68P and thought it was time to upgrade. I bought a AC-86U and the setup was simple since I kept the info from the old one. I've already had the dreaded 2.4 dropout so I reset and researched. There is a setting I changed and I am going to try it before I decide to return it changed the 20/40 Mhz to 20 Mhz on the 2.4Ghz setting. Would have got 5 stars if not for that. Also the button on the back that turns the LED lights on and off doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: SoonerNArkansas

customer_reviews.title: Bricked after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I should have heeded the other reviews on this router! Received and immediately updated the firmware as many reviews encouraged. Router was fast, had excellent coverage and worked great for 2 weeks. Saturday evening it randomly stopped working and started a boot loop (bricked). After spending 1.5 hours on phone with ASUS support trying to recover they recommended returning the router! Always been a fan of ASUS with a rock solid AC68U running for years, but this AC88U router is junk! Returned to Amazon for refund.
customer_reviews.author: B. Tedder

customer_reviews.title: Worthless Wireless Router!
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing ASUS wireless routers for a while and the RT-AC86U is the only one that died after two days! I have done the ritual of rebooting, resetting, and flashing the firmware in recovery mode without avail. Tech support told me to try to flash the firmware in recovery mode again (smh) and if that does not work contact them again. If you are planning on purchasing an ASUS RT-AC86U (AC2900), DO NOT (walk away slowly)! I am returning this wireless router (junk) to Amazon. Should I buy another ASUS wireless router?
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

product_meta.title: ASUS AC2900 WiFi Dual-band Gigabit Wireless Router with 1.8GHz Dual-core Processor and AiProtection Network Security Powered by Trend Micro, AiMesh Whole Home WiFi System Compatible (RT-AC86U)
product_meta.description: Style:AC2900 | Dual-BandDesigned to deliver jaw-dropping network performance, The ASUS RT-AC86U features a 1. 8GHz dual-core processor with the latest 802. 11AC MU-MIMO technology. Maximize your online experience with game-boosting Adaptive Qu's, gamers private network by Waist, and built-in network security from Protection. Use the ASUS router app to manage your network while on-the-go. Wi-Fi technology is 20/40/80 MHz bandwidth. Note-if having issues connecting to 5 GHz network make sure that wireless device supports 5 GHz or features dual Band capabilities
feature_bullets: Dual-band (2. 4 + 5 GHz) AC2900 wireless router with the latest 802. 11AC MU-MIMO technology for data transfer speeds up to 2900 Mbps
1. 8GHz 32bit dual-core processor optimizes network traffic and connectivity speeds from the USB 3. 1 Gen1 and 4x Gigabit LAN ports
Designed for lag-free online gaming and flawless 4K UHD streaming with WTFast game Accelerator and adaptive QoS; Product Segment: AC2900 ultimate AC performance: 750+2167 Mbps

A protection powered by Trend Micro provides built-in 24/7 protection from external attacks and threats, neutralizing them before they reach your network or connected devices.DC Output : 19 V with max. 1.75 A current

Manage your network with the ASUS router app – setup your network, manage usage and parental controls, even get instant notifications about important network-based events. Connected devices must be 802. 11 ac-compatible for best results. Ac input: 110v240v(5060hz)

specifications.Operating System: Windows® 10;Windows® 8;Windows® 7;Mac OS X 10.6;Mac OS X 10.7;Mac OS X 10.8;Linux
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,919 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
